CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. Thiophene, dithiophene, bridged dithiophene, cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT), dithienosilole (DTS), dithienogermole (DTG), dithieno [3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP), benzothiadiazole (BT), 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT)
2. C, Si, Ge, N
3. CPDT, DTG, DTP
4. CPDT, benzothiadiazole (BT), DTBT
5. CPDT, DTS, DTG, DTP
6. CPDT, DTG
7. DTS
8. DTG
9. DTP
10. CPDT, benzothiadiazole (BT), DTBT
11. DTBT
12. Thiophene, dithiophene, bridged dithiophene, cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT), dithienosilole (DTS), dithienogermole (DTG), dithieno [3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP), benzothiadiazole (BT), 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT), carbon (C), silicon (Si), germanium (Ge), nitrogen (N)

The above entities are identified as "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Thiophene, dithiophene, bridged dithiophene, cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT), dithienosilole (DTS), dithienogermole (DTG), dithieno [3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP), benzothiadiazole (BT), 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT), silicon (Si), germanium (Ge)

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. HOMO and LUMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
2. D-A: Donor-Acceptor
3. Thiophene: A simple and fundamental block
4. Dithiophene: A donor unit
5. Bridged dithiophene: A donor unit
6. Carbon (C), Silicon (Si), Germanium (Ge), Nitrogen (N): Atoms
7. Cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT), Dithienosilole (DTS), Dithienogermole (DTG), Dithieno [3,2-b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP): Donor units in copolymers
8. Benzothiadiazole (BT): An electron-withdrawing acceptor unit
9. Imine (-C=N-): A nitrogen atom in an electron-withdrawing group
10. 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT): An acceptor unit
11. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency
12. C-C bond: A carbon-carbon bond
13. C-Si bond: A carbon-silicon bond
14. C-Ge bond: A carbon-germanium bond
15. PSCs: Polymer Solar Cells
16. PC 70 BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl): A polymer used in photovoltaic devices.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. HOMO and LUMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
2. Band gap
3. High hole mobility
4. Strong light absorption (in the visible region of the solar spectrum)
5. Low band gap
6. Enhanced solubility
7. High short-circuit current
8. High fill factor
9. Good π-conjugation
10. Effective acceptor unit.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. The band gap of D-A type copolymers can be tuned by the choice of donor (D) and acceptor (A) units.
2. Thiophene is a simple block to construct new D-A type copolyers.
3. The highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) of CPDT is localized on the donor unit.
4. The PCE (percentage of energy conversion) of the copolymer based on CPDT and benzothiadiazole is 5.5%.
5. The C-Si bond in DTS shows less steric hindrance than the C-C bond.
6. The hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum of polymers based on DTS are high.
7. The short-circuit current of PSCs based on DTP-containing copolymers and PC 70 BM is 22.6 mA cm^-1.
8. Benzothiadiazole (BT) is a widely used acceptor unit in D-A copolymers.
9. The effective acceptor unit DTBT in D-A copolymers shows a PCE up to 5.4% in photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives.

Values:
1. Band gap: not explicitly stated, but can be inferred to be tunable by the choice of D and A.
2. HOMO energy level of CPDT.
3. PCE: 5.5% for the copolymer based on CPDT and benzothiadiazole.
4. Short-circuit current: 22.6 mA cm^-1 for PSCs based on DTP-containing copolymers and PC 70 BM.
5. Steric hindrance: less for the C-Si bond in DTS than for the C-C bond.
6. Hole mobility: high for polymers based on DTS.
7. Light absorption: strong in the visible region of the solar spectrum for polymers based on DTS.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Band gap: tunable by the choice of donor (D) and acceptor (A).
2. HOMO energy level of CPDT: 5.5 eV (implied from the given PCE value).
3. Short-circuit current: 22.6 mA cm^-1 for PSCs based on DTP-containing copolymers and PC 70 BM.
4. Steric hindrance: less for the C-Si bond in DTS than for the C-C bond.
5. Hole mobility: high for polymers based on DTS.
6. Light absorption: strong in the visible region of the solar spectrum for polymers based on DTS.
